Terms and Conditions

1. Purpose

These terms and conditions govern the contractual relationship between SESEC and its clients for cybersecurity consulting services.

By engaging our services, you agree to be bound by these terms and conditions.

2. Services

2.1 Cybersecurity Consulting

SESEC provides professional cybersecurity consulting services including:

  • Security assessments and audits
  • Vulnerability testing and penetration testing
  • Security architecture design
  • Compliance consulting (ISO 27001, GDPR, etc.)
  • Incident response and forensics
  • Security training and awareness
  • Risk management consulting

2.2 Service Delivery

Services are delivered according to agreed specifications, timelines, and methodologies outlined in individual service agreements.

3. Contracting Process

3.1 Service Agreement

Each engagement requires a written service agreement specifying:

  • Scope of work and deliverables
  • Timeline and milestones
  • Fees and payment terms
  • Confidentiality requirements
  • Liability limitations

3.2 Acceptance

Services commence upon signed agreement and receipt of any required advance payment.

4. Client Obligations

4.1 Cooperation

The client agrees to:

  • Provide necessary access to systems and information
  • Designate qualified personnel for coordination
  • Respond promptly to requests for information
  • Implement recommended security measures
  • Maintain confidentiality of methodologies

4.2 System Access

Client is responsible for providing secure, authorized access to systems under assessment and ensuring all necessary permissions are obtained.

5. Confidentiality

5.1 Mutual Confidentiality

Both parties agree to maintain strict confidentiality regarding:

  • Proprietary information and trade secrets
  • Security vulnerabilities and findings
  • Business operations and strategies
  • Technical methodologies and tools

5.2 Data Protection

SESEC implements appropriate safeguards to protect client data and complies with applicable data protection regulations.

6. Fees and Payment

6.1 Fee Structure

Fees are determined based on:

  • Scope and complexity of services
  • Time and resources required
  • Specialized expertise needed
  • Urgency of delivery

6.2 Payment Terms

  • Invoices are payable within 30 days of receipt
  • Late payments may incur interest charges
  • Advance payments may be required for certain services
  • All fees are exclusive of applicable taxes

7. Liability and Warranties

7.1 Service Warranties

SESEC warrants that services will be performed:

  • With professional skill and care
  • In accordance with industry standards
  • By qualified cybersecurity professionals
  • Within agreed timelines

7.2 Limitation of Liability

SESEC's liability is limited to:

  • Direct damages only (no consequential damages)
  • Maximum amount equal to fees paid for the specific service
  • Claims must be made within 12 months of service completion

7.3 Disclaimer

SESEC does not guarantee that:

  • All security vulnerabilities will be identified
  • Systems will be immune from future attacks
  • Compliance will be maintained indefinitely

8. Intellectual Property

8.1 Deliverables

Client owns rights to specific deliverables created for their engagement, subject to SESEC's retained rights in methodologies and tools.

8.2 SESEC Property

SESEC retains ownership of:

  • Proprietary methodologies and frameworks
  • Software tools and technologies
  • General knowledge and experience
  • Benchmark data and industry insights

9. Termination

9.1 Termination Rights

Either party may terminate services:

  • For material breach with 30 days written notice
  • For convenience with 60 days written notice
  • Immediately for insolvency or legal violations

9.2 Effect of Termination

Upon termination:

  • Client pays for services performed to date
  • Confidentiality obligations continue
  • Work product is delivered in current state
  • Each party returns confidential materials

10. Dispute Resolution

10.1 Negotiation

Parties agree to first attempt resolution through good faith negotiation.

10.2 Mediation and Arbitration

Unresolved disputes will be subject to:

  • Mediation before a qualified mediator
  • Binding arbitration if mediation fails
  • Proceedings conducted in Spain
  • Spanish law governs interpretation

11. Force Majeure

Neither party is liable for delays or failures due to circumstances beyond reasonable control, including natural disasters, government actions, or cyber attacks.

12. Modifications

These terms may be modified only by written agreement signed by both parties. Updates will be posted on our website with effective dates.

13. Governing Law

These terms are governed by Spanish law. Spanish courts have exclusive jurisdiction over any disputes.

14. Contact Information

For questions about these terms:

  • Email: legal@sesecpro.com
  • Phone: +34 XXX XXX XXX
  • Address: Spain
